results.relevance_explanation: While marketing can involve some analytical skills, the position as described in the letter does not directly align with the technical aspects of an Information Technology degree. It lacks specific technical IT skills or application to IT related projects.
results.calculation_breakdown: 320 hours / 27 hours per ECTS = 11.0 credits, capped at 10.0 maximum for general training
results.supporting_evidence: The work experience provides general workplace experience and could contribute to communication and organizational skills.
results.challenging_evidence: The position lacks specific technical or IT-related responsibilities relevant to an Information Technology degree.
results.recommendation_reasoning: The Marketing Manager role does not have significant technical overlap with an Information Technology degree, but it does offer transferable skills applicable to any workplace. Therefore, classifying it as general training is appropriate.
results.summary_justification: The work experience, while valuable, does not demonstrate sufficient alignment with Information Technology degree requirements to justify professional training classification. The tasks are primarily marketing-oriented rather than IT-focused.
results.justification: The work experience meets the criteria for general training as requested. The role, while not directly related to Information Technology, provides valuable transferable skills. Student would receive 10.0 ECTS credits toward the 30-credit practical training requirement.
